title: Getting Started with Vue 3
excerpt: Learn the basics of Vue 3 and how to build modern web applications with the latest features.
content:
Introduction to Vue 3

Vue 3 is the latest version of the Vue.js framework, bringing significant improvements and new features to the table.

Key Features

  • Composition API for better code organization
  • Improved TypeScript support
  • Better performance and smaller bundle size
  • Enhanced reactivity system

In this guide, we'll explore how to get started with Vue 3 and build your first application.
author: John Doe

title: Tailwind CSS Best Practices
excerpt: Master Tailwind CSS with these essential best practices for building scalable and maintainable designs.
content:
Tailwind CSS Best Practices

Tailwind CSS has revolutionized the way we write CSS. Here are some best practices to follow.

1. Use Custom Configuration

Customize your Tailwind config to match your design system.

2. Organize Your Utilities

Keep your utility classes organized and avoid duplication.

3. Extract Components

Use @apply to extract common patterns into reusable components.

Pinia State Management

Pinia is the official state management library for Vue 3.

Why Pinia?

  • Simple and intuitive API
  • Full TypeScript support
  • DevTools integration
  • Hot Module Replacement

Let's explore how to use Pinia in your Vue applications.
